chapter.para: This chapter provides an overview on how to create additional administrators for your ∩ cluster.

sect1.title: Prerequisites
sect1.para: The following prerequisites are required in order to create additional ∩ cluster administrators:

sect1.title: Creating an Example ∩ Cluster Administrator
sect1.para: The following example demonstrates the steps required to create a new administrator user for your ∩ cluster. Note that creating administrator accounts must be done using the UAAC and cannot be done using the &cfcli;.
sect1.procedure:
&uaac-target; &uaac-authenticate;
Create a new user:
&prompt.user;uaac user add new-admin --password password --emails new-admin@example.com --zone scf
Add the new user to the following groups to grant administrator privileges to the cluster (see for information on privileges provided by each group):
&prompt.user;uaac member add scim.write new-admin --zone scf
&prompt.user;uaac member add scim.read new-admin --zone scf
&prompt.user;uaac member add cloud_controller.admin new-admin --zone scf
&prompt.user;uaac member add clients.read new-admin --zone scf
&prompt.user;uaac member add clients.write new-admin --zone scf
&prompt.user;uaac member add doppler.firehose new-admin --zone scf
&prompt.user;uaac member add routing.router_groups.read new-admin --zone scf
&prompt.user;uaac member add routing.router_groups.write new-admin --zone scf
Log into your ∩ deployment as the newly created administrator:
&prompt.user;cf api --skip-ssl-validation https://api.example.com
&prompt.user;cf login -u new-admin
The following commands can be used to verify the new administrator account has sufficient permissions:
&prompt.user;cf create-shared-domain test-domain.com
&prompt.user;cf set-org-role new-admin org OrgManager
&prompt.user;cf create-buildpack test_buildpack /tmp/ruby_buildpack-cached-sle15-v1.7.30.1.zip 1
If the account has sufficient permissions, you should not receive any authorization message similar to the following:
FAILED Server error, status code: 403, error code: 10003, message: You are not authorized to perform the requested action
See for other administrator-specific commands that can be run to confirm sufficient permissions are provided.
